title: How to Get Started with Laravel
content:
Laravel is a powerful PHP framework. Here's how to install it:

  • Install Composer
  • Run composer create-project laravel/laravel example-app
  • Configure your .env file

Start building!

title: Mastering PHP 8 Features
content:
PHP 8 introduced powerful features like attributes, union types, and the JIT compiler.

  • Use Attributes for cleaner metadata
  • Optimize performance with JIT
  • Take advantage of match expressions

title: Improving Website Performance
content:
Boost load times using caching, minification, and image optimization.

Tools like Lighthouse help measure progress.

title: API Authentication with Laravel Sanctum
content:
Sanctum provides lightweight authentication for SPAs and mobile apps.

Setup involves publishing configs and adding middleware.

title: Deploying Laravel Apps on DigitalOcean
content:
Deploy using droplets, Nginx, and Laravel Forge.

Don't forget to set up queues and caching!

title: Debugging in Laravel with Telescope
content:
Laravel Telescope helps monitor requests, exceptions, and queries.

Install via Composer and enable in your config files.

title: Writing Clean Code in PHP
content:
Follow SOLID principles, keep functions small, and write clear variable names.

Consistency is key.

title: Understanding RESTful APIs
content:
REST principles include statelessness, resources, and uniform interfaces.

Great for building scalable web services.

title: Intro to Tailwind CSS
content:

title: How to Use Laravel Queues
content:
Queues help handle time-consuming tasks asynchronously.

Use workers, drivers, and dispatchable jobs.
